sense.def: 則民易使也"then the people are easy to deploy": modal particle which emphasises the apodosis (sometimes also of a concessive clause in 'even if) as typically general and inevitable.
則家宰之罪也“then this will be the fault of the manager of the household": then the protasis (if-clause) S is N{PRED}
intensifying particle: really, indeed; 不知也 "I have no idea";不自非也"did not disavow himself in the least"
In Shuowen Dictionary only: vagina
富而可求也"If it had been proper to aim for wealth": factual, not narrative: if it were a fact that, if it were true that
特祿仕之臣也 "had he just been..." counterfactual conditional with a nominal predicate subordinate clause
克能也“克means something along the lines of ‘can'（in this context)": lexicographic gloss: (The expression) means "to V" or "suggests that V" here/in this context
卬我也“ang means 'I'.": lexicographic gloss; (the expression N{SUBJ}) is an/is to be taken to mean (something more or less like! N{PRED}
予之不仁也！“How inhumane Yú is!": Oh for the subject's V-ing:
causal: marking causal subordinate clause: Since
Since (the fact is that) S1, then S2
聖人也“is a sage": is to be classified as an N
我無是也“I do not have such": "it may be said that, it is a fact that", "the point is" marks a judgemental non-narrative verbal sentence, often as being basic or explanatory
勿欺也！“One must not cheat!": marks the generality of an imperative as being not limited to a certain occasion or time
勿告也"One should not tell him!" "the thing to do now is": sentence final particle in imperative or injunctive sentences
無知也“I have no understanding": final particle marking non-narrative judgemental descriptive statements or subjective judgmental appraisals
吾與點也“I side with Dian": "and the concluding point is that": marker of a concluding judgment or a concluding contrastive judgmental clause.

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: NPab=an S nominalised by 之/其

sense.def: 不知其可也“I do not know what is acceptible about him": marker of sentential complements, which are typically nominalised by 之/其
無法也“This is lawlessness": "this is an instance of" marks the classification of a subject as being an instance of the unmarked nominalisation of a VP
非其罪也“it was not his fault": marker of negated abstract nominal feature predicate
未之聞也"this is unheard of (not narratively 'this I have never heard of'.)": particle marking a generalising judgment
仁也"is an instance of benevolence": particle marking the instantiation of an abstract feature Nab
由也升堂矣，未入其室也。 "Our friend Zǐlù has ascended the main hall, but has not yet entered the rooms": contrastively non-perfective judgmental particle
吾聞之也 marker of a main sentence a cataphoric pronoun in which is specified in the sentence that follows
非不能也 "it is not a case of being unable" "it is not as if the subject was not V-ing" dismissing one negative judgment and suggesting there is another judgment that is true
marker of passive putative use of predicative nominal
postverbal particle preceded by the subject N
marking that N{PRED} classifies an autonymous N{SUBJ}
marking emphatic contrastive judgement (that is the opposite of what precedes)
marking preliminary concessive judgemental clause
是知王道者也 "Such is the one who properly understands the way of a (true) king"
marks a sequence of sentences as being generalising rather than concretely narrative
SS, 行之節也 “..., this is the rhythm of traveling [by chariot]"
marker of second of two alternative judgmental questions
何謂也"What does this mean?“: marks a judgmental question sentence
孰不可忍也？"Then what is not bearable?": particle marking an (often generalising) rhetorical question
何器也？"What instrument is this?": particle marking a question sentence with a nominal predicate e.g. 何器也？
十世可知也？"Can one get to know matters ten generations ago?": marks judgmental general questions
何也“Why is that?": marking questions consisting of a question pronoun only
古之愚也直“The stupid in antiquity were straightforward.“ That such a man should suffers such a disease!": postnominal particle, topic marker

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: NPab nominalised with 之or 其

sense.def: 道之不行也"Given the fact that the Way is not being practised": after a nominalised clause which is used as topic
與其奢也寧儉rather than being lavish one should be economic
必也 "what is necessary" after topics other than personal names
回也其庶乎！ after (one or two) personal names: that fellow NN; our friend NN; our friends NN and NN
丘也嘗使於楚矣 "I once was employed in Chu": after personal names referring to the speaker
賢哉回也 our friend NN, that fellow NN
賜也樂乎？"Did you enjoy it, Si?": you, my friend Npr; you, our friend Npr
使獲也佐吾子
久矣哉由之行詐也"It has been going on for a long time that You has practised deceit": marker of a nominalised sentence that functions as the subject of a preceding verb phrase
postnominal particle after proper name objects
as far as N is concerned, it works like this: S
topicalised subject marker
不聽其言也“In case he does not accept the proposal": in case that; if ever S; even if ever

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: nominalisation with 之 or 其

sense.def: 君子之仕也“If the gentleman serves in office" marker of a subordinate conditional clause, the protasis
勿內也"He is not to be let in!": judgment-based imperative, imperative implying a judgment that the order is the right one to give
post-sentential topic marker, marker of sentence topics
桀、紂、盜跖也。"Jie, Zhou and the Robber Zhi are cases in point": be exempified by Npr (sometimes several Npr coordinated)

entry.def: Sentence-final yě 也 often marks because-clauses: S也 meaning "it was because of S".

sense.def: 陋也"it is because they are vulgar": be because of S; be a matter of S, depend on S
命也“it is because of fate": be because of N; be because of the reason N; depend on N
because the before-mentioned subject aims to V
be because of the npro, be the 'fault' of the npro
馬不進也"The horses would not move forward": "the explanation is" the fact is; the point is that
非道也“that is not (identical with/nothing other than) the Way" : be none other than, be identical with N
X字也"X is his given name/style": N is used as a name for the word itself, i.e. is autonymous in Bertrand Russell's terminology
我也"that is me": be none other than N
理也，義也 “principled nature, i.e. righteousness": id est, i.e., that is to say, more specifically
also in this case> even N (the N often being a preposed topic)

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

entry.def: Yě 也 is frequently used at the end of sentences to form temporal subordinate clauses which provide background, often in conjunction with qí 其.

sense.def: 君子之至於斯也"When the true gentleman gets here": when
白公之亂也"At the time of Lord Bai's revolt": at the time N

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: SUBJ of V1 = SUBJ of V2

sense.def: 吾少也賤人“I, when young was of humble status": after V1-ing, when V1-ing
昔堯、舜之為君也，維恐...“When Yao and Shun were rulers, their only/main fear was...":marking temporal subordinate clause, the subject of which continues implicitly in the main clause: When
when
仲尼日月也"Confucius is like the sun and the moon": marking metaphorical nominal predication: "be like"
